text:
Completed list of functions in classes.rst

Also added some links, removed broken ones.
The non-custom things description is currently in part 2. I didn't repeat it.

In 3.1, there should be a subsection about non custom things (i.e. using the NiftiMasker as a black box, giving it filenames, using the MultiNiftiMasker when you have several subjects) before custom things :)
Added a lot of links in extraction_data.rst
The non-custom things description is currently in part 2. I didn't repeat it.

This is the first step toward a module dedicated to decoding algorithms.

The non-custom things description is currently in part 2. I didn't repeat it.

Actually, could you rather create a directory 'decoding' and put a
searchlight.py file in there. If we add more methods, having a single
file will not scale.

In 3.1, there should be a subsection about non custom things (i.e. using the NiftiMasker as a black box, giving it filenames, using the MultiNiftiMasker when you have several subjects) before custom things :)

One more big incompatible change: the "searchlight" module was renamed to "decoding", which is supposed to contain in the long run every decoding algorithm implemented in nisl. This in turn may change in the future, but this is a step in the right direction.

searchlight.py file in there. If we add more methods, having a single

One more big incompatible change: the "searchlight" module was renamed to "decoding", which is supposed to contain in the long run every decoding algorithm implemented in nisl. This in turn may change in the future, but this is a step in the right direction.

Fixed plot_simulated_data.py

Fixed what appeared to be a bug in searchlight (removed two lines
with unknown significance).
measures
Fixed docstrings, code clean up.
measures

Used _apply_mask_fmri() in searchlight

The _apply_mask_fmri() function was used instead of an ad-hoc solution,
to avoid code duplication.
measures

I fixed what I consider as a bug in 0fecd4b. I removed two lines whose usefulness is doubtful to me (to say the least) (lines 145-146). If someone has an idea, I'd appreciate it. Removing them removed artifacts that occured in plot_simulated_data.py. 

After fixing plot_simulated_data.py, the result of searchlight seems to be reasonable. It is not just noise as before.
Good to merge for me.

"copy" kwarg in resample_img works in all cases

In some no-op cases, the "copy" keyword did nothing.
Added some tests cases. 100% test coverage for nisl.resampling.
Very cool!
Indeed ! I did not knew this one.
I didn't either a few hours ago :-)

This is not garantied to induce a copy: 
In [11]: a = np.zeros((10, 10, 10))

In [12]: af = np.identity(4)

In [13]: niimg = nibabel.Nifti1Image(a, af)

In [16]: data = niimg.get_data()

In [17]: data2 = niimg.get_data()

In [18]: np.may_share_memory(data, data2)
Out[18]: True
Of course, if the input niimg was a file name this copy is irrelevant. This is why I think that it is of high priority to add a "copy" keyword argument to check_niimg.
True. I already did this mistake before. I'll add the "copy" keyword argument asap.

"smooth" renamed in "smoothing_fwhm"

The "smooth" parameter has been renamed in "smoothing_fwhm" for clarity.
The original name has been kept in _smooth_array() and image.smooth().

Some minor fixes have been performed as well.
Done with my review! :)

> For me, "smooth" hints at a boolean flag. I definitely prefer smoothing_fwhm,
> even if it's longer.

That's fine with me.
OK, I see where mem is needed... I guess we need an explanation for the user who does not know joblib.
I'll clean this, it was initially a copy-paste of test_nifti_maps_masker().

Hum, actually, compcorr should be in the ADHD sets of confounds, I believe, so you don't need this.
We need a more explicit name. Maybe "resampling_target".

I had left 'smooth' on purpose here, because I felt that in the context of "apply_mask", or a Masker object, "fwhm" had no meaning. Maybe we could have "smoothing_fwhm", but I think that I prefer "smooth".

Added resampling to NiftiLabelsMasker

resampling_target parameter has been added to NiftiLabelsMasker. Only one
target has been implemented: labels, because resampling labels is considered
dangerous right now.

Corrected a bug in NiftiMapsMasker: the interpolation method used for "maps"
and "mask" targets were swapped.

I wonder if it is worth define 3 different variables (affine1, affine2, and affine3), if we set them all equal. I am just trying to make the test shorter and thus more readable.

> What do you think? Is this feature useful?

The question is: how does resampling_target affect the output of
inverse_transform?

Changed output of region signal extracting functions

img_to_signals_labels() and img_to_signals_maps() now always return a
number of signals equal to the number of regions passed as parameter. In
the previous state, only regions not fully outside the mask were
considered, the number of output signals thus could vary. This is not
the case anymore.

Tests have been adapted.
